text: (gentle music)

- [Narrator] Organizations
are generating and collecting
more operational data than ever before

about their equipment,
processes and facilities.
Fueled by advances in IOT, AI,
and cloud computing technologies,

many industrial companies
want to combine data
from their IOT sensors, video cameras,
and business applications,
to create digital twins

of their physical
equipment and environments.
Introducing AWS IOT TwinMaker,
a service that helps optimize operations
by making it faster and easier
for developers to create digital twins
of real world systems.
You can use AWS IOT TwinMaker
to connect to disparate data sources,
accurately model physical systems,

and create an immersive 3D
view into your operations.
A digital twin of a cookie factory

built with AWS IOT TwinMaker
combines existing 3D models
with real world data

to create a digital replica
of the physical environment.

This monitoring application
built with Grafana

uses the digital twin to
help factory operators
improve efficiency, increase production,
and raise performance.
Use the 3D scene viewer
to freely navigate the digital twin,

browse and select elements
in the hierarchy panel
to automatically navigate
to a specific area or piece of equipment.

Tags are used to bind
data from multiple sources
to equipment or physical systems.
Easily visualize different data sources,
such as sensor data,

live and historical
video feeds from cameras,

or business application
data like equipment manuals,

within the spatial context
of its environment.
Use alarm notifications and history

to easily identify and navigate
to malfunctioning equipment
and discover possible issues.
Now, let's walk through the key steps

of creating a digital twin
using AWS IOT TwinMaker.

Define components to connect
to various data sources.
You can use built-in data connectors

to access time series sensor
data from AWS IOT SiteWise

and video data from Amazon
Kinesis video streams.
Or you can create custom data connectors

for other data sources
like Amazon Timestream.
Create entities that represent and capture

the capabilities of
your physical equipment,
processes, and spaces.
Specify relationships between entities

and connect them to
different data sources,

which automatically creates
a digital twin graph,
managed by AWS IOT TwinMaker.

Upload your existing 3D
models and visual assets

to the resource library
that you want to use
to create your 3D visualization.
Using the scene composer,
add your 3D visual assets into a scene

and position them to match
your physical environment.
Then bind real world data,

such as sensors and video data,
from the digital twin graph.

Using the AWS IOT TwinMaker
plugin for Grafana,
you can then integrate the digital twin
into a web application
which allows your operators and engineers

to use the digital twin to
monitor and optimize operations.
Start building digital twins today
and see how AWS IOT TwinMaker can help you

improve operational efficiency
and reduce downtime.
